intro: Scirpus nutans, commonly known as the nodding bulrush, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and lakes. The plant has tall, slender stems that bear clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that droop downward, giving it its common name. Its roots are fibrous and help stabilize the soil in aquatic environments. Scirpus nutans plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
